section.heading: Periodic audit of insurers; required standard auditing procedures; information to be shared by Division of Insurance; report to Legislature.

content.p: The Administrator shall cause to be conducted at least every 5 years an audit of all insurers who provide benefits to injured employees pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS. The Administrator shall cause to be conducted each year on a random basis additional partial audits of any insurer who has a history of violations of the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS, or the regulations adopted pursuant thereto, as determined by the Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Administrator shall require the use of standard auditing procedures and shall establish a manual to describe the standard auditing procedures. The manual must include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Specific audit objectives; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Standards for documentation; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Policies for supervisory review; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Policies for the training of auditors; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The format for the audit report; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Procedures for the presentation, distribution and retention of the audit report. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Commissioner and the Administrator shall establish a procedure for sharing information between the Division of Insurance of the Department of Business and Industry and the Division concerning the qualifications of employers as self-insured employers pursuant toNRS 616B.300or as an association of self-insured public or private employers pursuant toNRS 616B.353. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

On or before March 1 of each year, the Administrator shall make a report of each audit to the Legislature, if it is in session, or to the Interim Finance Committee if the Legislature is not in session.

section.heading: Insurers to cooperate with Commissioner; duty of private carriers to provide certain information to Commissioner.

content.p: Each insurer shall cooperate with the Commissioner in the performance of his or her duties pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS. Each private carrier shall provide the Commissioner with any information, statistics or data in its records which pertain to any employer who is making an application to become self-insured or who is self-insured, or who is becoming or who is a member of an association of self-insured public or private employers.

section.heading: Insurer required to provide information necessary for enforcement of statutes, regulations or standards; Administrator required to make written request for information.

content.p: An insurer shall provide to the Administrator upon written request only information in its possession which is necessary for the enforcement of any provision of this chapter orchapter 616A,616C,616Dor617of NRS, or any regulation or standard adopted pursuant thereto, within 30 days after the date of the request. The written request must specifically indicate: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
What information is being requested; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The statute, regulation or standard adopted pursuant thereto for which the information is needed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon the receipt of a written request from an insurer, the Administrator may extend the time within which information must be provided if good cause for granting the extension is shown.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1991, 2394)—(Substituted in revision for NRS 616.191)

section.heading: Reports required to be made by insurers.

content.p: All insurers shall report to the Administrator, annually or at intervals which the Administrator requires, all accidental injuries, occupational diseases, dispositions of claims and payments made pursuant tochapters 616Ato617, inclusive, of NRS or regulations adopted by the Division pursuant thereto. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Each self-insured employer and association of self-insured public or private employers shall report its reserves to the Administrator in the manner prescribed in subsection 1.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1979, 1038; A1981, 1469;1993, 712,1862;1995, 531,2022)—(Substituted in revision for NRS 616.337)

section.heading: Request for health care records; fees.

content.p: If an injured employee or his or her legal representative requests health care records from an insurer, third-party administrator or employer pursuant to subsection 2 ofNRS 616B.012, any other provision ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS or any regulation adopted pursuant thereto, the insurer, third-party administrator or employer shall furnish a copy of the requested records to the injured employee or legal representative. Such records may be furnished in an electronic format using a method of secure electronic transmission that complies with applicable federal and state law. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an insurer, third-party administrator or employer maintains health care records electronically, any fee to furnish those records in an electronic format pursuant to subsection 1 must not exceed: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fifteen dollars for records able to be delivered by electronic mail; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Twenty-five dollars for records required to be delivered using a secure electronic method of file sharing. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any fee to furnish health care records in a form that is not electronic pursuant to subsection 1 must not exceed 30 cents per page. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Health care recordsï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 629.021and additionally includes individually identifiable health information, as defined in 45 C.F.R. ï¿½ 160.103. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Secure electronic transmissionï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it in section 1 of this act.

section.heading: Confidentiality and disclosure of information; penalty for disclosure or use of information; privileged communications.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this section andNRS 239.0115,607.217,616B.011,616B.015,616B.021and616C.205, information obtained from any insurer, employer or employee is confidential and may not be disclosed or be open to public inspection in any manner which would reveal the personï¿½s identity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any claimant or legal representative of the claimant is entitled to information from the records of the insurer, to the extent necessary for the proper presentation of a claim in any proceeding underchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Division and Administrator are entitled to information from the records of the insurer which is necessary for the performance of their duties. The Administrator may, by regulation, prescribe the manner in which otherwise confidential information may be made available to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any agency of this or any other state charged with the administration or enforcement of laws relating to industrial insurance, unemployment compensation, public assistance or labor law and industrial relations; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department of Taxation; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The State Contractorsï¿½ Board in the performance of its duties to enforce the provisions ofchapter 624of NRS. ï¿½Information obtained in connection with the administration of a program of industrial insurance may be made available to persons or agencies for purposes appropriate to the operation of a program of industrial insurance. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon written request made by a public officer of a local government, an insurer shall furnish from its records the name, address and place of employment of any person listed in its records. The request must set forth the social security number of the person about whom the request is made and contain a statement signed by proper authority of the local government certifying that the request is made to allow the proper authority to enforce a law to recover a debt or obligation owed to the local government. Except as otherwise provided inNRS 239.0115, the information obtained by the local government is confidential and may not be used or disclosed for any purpose other than the collection of a debt or obligation owed to the local government. The insurer may charge a reasonable fee for the cost of providing the requested information. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

To further a current criminal investigation, the chief executive officer of any law enforcement agency of this State may submit to the Administrator a written request for the name, address and place of employment of any person listed in the records of an insurer. The request must set forth the social security number of the person about whom the request is made and contain a statement signed by the chief executive officer certifying that the request is made to further a criminal investigation currently being conducted by the agency. Upon receipt of a request, the Administrator shall instruct the insurer to furnish the information requested. Upon receipt of such an instruction, the insurer shall furnish the information requested. The insurer may charge a reasonable fee to cover any related administrative expenses. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon request by the Department of Taxation, the Administrator shall provide: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Lists containing the names and addresses of employers; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Other information concerning employers collected and maintained by the Administrator or the Division to carry out the purposes ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS, ï¿½to the Department for its use in verifying returns for the taxes imposed pursuant tochapters 363A,363B,363Cand363Dof NRS. The Administrator may charge a reasonable fee to cover any related administrative expenses. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any person who, in violation of this section, discloses information obtained from files of claimants or policyholders or obtains a list of claimants or policyholders underchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS and uses or permits the use of the list for any political purposes, is guilty of a gross misdemeanor. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

All letters, reports or communications of any kind, oral or written, from the insurer, or any of its agents, representatives or employees are privileged and must not be the subject matter or basis for any lawsuit if the letter, report or communication is written, sent, delivered or prepared pursuant to the requirements ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not prohibit the Administrator or the Division from: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Disclosing any nonproprietary information relating to an uninsured employer or proof of industrial insurance; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Notifying an injured employee or the surviving spouse or dependent of an injured employee of benefits to which such persons may be entitled in addition to those provided pursuant to the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS but only if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notification is solely for the purpose of informing the recipient of benefits that are available to the recipient; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The content of the notification is limited to information concerning services which are offered by nonprofit entities.

section.heading: Confidentiality of certain records and files of Division of Insurance concerning self-insured employers and associations of self-insured public or private employers; exceptions.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2 andNRS 239.0115and607.217, the records and files of the Division concerning self-insured employers and associations of self-insured public or private employers are confidential and may be revealed in whole or in part only in the course of the administration of the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS relating to those employers or upon the lawful order of a court of competent jurisdiction. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The records and files specified in subsection 1 are not confidential in the following cases: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Testimony by an officer or agent of the Division and the production of records and files on behalf of the Division in any action or proceeding conducted pursuant to the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS if that testimony or the records and files, or the facts shown thereby, are involved in the action or proceeding. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Delivery to a self-insured employer or an association of self-insured public or private employers of a copy of any document filed by the employer with the Division pursuant to the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Publication of statistics if classified so as to prevent: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Identification of a particular employer or document; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Disclosure of the financial or business condition of a particular employer or insurer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Disclosure in confidence, without further distribution or disclosure to any other person, to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Attorney General or other legal representative of the State in connection with an action or proceeding conducted pursuant to the provisions ofchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any agency of this or any other state charged with the administration or enforcement of the laws relating to workersï¿½ compensation or unemployment compensation; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any federal, state or local law enforcement agency. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Disclosure in confidence by a person who receives information pursuant to paragraph
to a person in furtherance of the administration or enforcement of the laws relating to workersï¿½ compensation or unemployment compensation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Divisionï¿½ means the Division of Insurance of the Department of Business and Industry. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Records and filesï¿½ means: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

All credit reports, references, investigative records, financial information and data pertaining to the net worth of a self-insured employer or association of self-insured public or private employers; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

All information and data required by the Division to be furnished to it pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS or which may be otherwise obtained relative to the finances, earnings, revenue, trade secrets or the financial condition of any self-insured employer or association of self-insured public or private employers.

section.heading: Index of claims: Establishment; contents; format; use; fee; administrative fine for failure by insurer to provide information.

content.p: The Administrator shall establish a method of indexing claims for compensation that will make information concerning the claimants of an insurer available to other insurers and the Fraud Control Unit for Industrial Insurance established pursuant toNRS 228.420. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Every insurer shall provide the following information if required by the Administrator for establishing and maintaining the index of claims: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the employer of the injured employee is a member of an association of self-insured public or private employers, the name and tax identification number of that association; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name and tax identification number of the insurer, unless the employer of the injured employee is self-insured and this requirement would duplicate the information required pursuant to paragraph
; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The date upon which the employerï¿½s policy of industrial insurance that covers the claim became effective and the date upon which it will expire or must be renewed; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the claim has been closed, whether the closure was pursuant to the provisions of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subsection 2 ofNRS 616C.235; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subsection 1 ofNRS 616C.235, ï¿½and what type of compensation was provided for the claim. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Administrator shall require information provided pursuant to subsection 2 to be submitted: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In a format that is consistent with nationally recognized standards for the reporting of data regarding industrial insurance; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Electronically or in another medium approved by the Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Administrator shall ensure that the requirement for an insurer to provide information pursuant to subsection 2 is administered in a fair and equal manner so that an insurer is not required to provide more or a different type of information than another insurer similarly situated. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not prevent the Administrator from: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conducting audits pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 616B.003and collecting information from such audits; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Receiving and collecting information from the reports that insurers must submit to the Administrator pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 616B.009; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Investigating alleged violations of the provisions ofchapters 616Ato617, inclusive, of NRS; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Enforcing the provisions ofchapters 616Ato617, inclusive, of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an employee files a claim with an insurer, the insurer is entitled to receive from the Administrator a list of the prior claims of the employee. If the insurer desires to inspect the files related to the prior claims, the insurer must obtain the written consent of the employee. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any information obtained from the index of claims may be admitted into evidence in any hearing before an appeals officer, a hearing officer or the Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Division may assess and collect a reasonable fee for its services provided pursuant to this section. The fee must be payable monthly or at such other intervals as determined by the Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the Administrator determines that an insurer has intentionally failed to provide the information required by subsection 2, the Administrator shall impose an administrative fine of $1,000 for the initial violation, and a fine of $2,000 for a second or subsequent violation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½tax identification numberï¿½ means the number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service of the United States Department of the Treasury for identification.

section.heading: Files of claims: Availability; maintenance; inspection; reproduction.

content.p: An insurer shall make the files of claims available for inspection and reproduction: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At an office operated by the insurer or its third-party administrator located in this State; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
By electronic means. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The physical records in a file concerning a claim filed in this State may be kept at a location outside this State if all records in the file are made available for inspection and reproduction at an office operated by the insurer or its third-party administrator that is located in this State or by computer in a microphotographic, electronic or other similar format that produces an accurate reproduction of the original. If a claim filed in this State is open, the records in the file must be reproduced and available for inspection during regular business hours within 24 hours after requested by the employee or the employeeï¿½s designated agent, the employer or the employerï¿½s designated agent, or the Administrator or the Administratorï¿½s designated agent. If a claim filed in this State is closed, the records in the file must be reproduced and available for inspection during regular business hours within 14 days after requested by such persons. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon request, the insurer shall make copies or other reproductions of anything in the file and may charge a reasonable fee for this service. Copies or other reproductions of materials in the file which are requested by the Administrator or the Administratorï¿½s designated agent, or the Nevada Attorney for Injured Workers or his or her designated agent must be provided free of charge. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Administrator may adopt regulations concerning the: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Maintenance of records in a file on claims that are open or closed; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Preservation, examination and use of records which have been stored on computer or in a microphotographic, electronic or similar format by an insurer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
This section does not require an insurer to allow inspection or reproduction of material regarding which a legal privilege against disclosure has been conferred.

section.heading: Destruction of records.

content.p: Upon written approval of the Administrator, the insurer may destroy accumulated and noncurrent detail records such as payroll reports, checks, claims, and other records of similar importance for the period July 1, 1913, to January 1, 1947, if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Claims from January 1, 1940, and after are first microphotographed; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A brief inventory of the destroyed records is retained. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The insurer may dispose of or destroy any record which has been microphotographed or filmed if the procedure required byNRS 239.051has been followed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The principal records, such as the general and regular journals and the general ledgers, must be retained intact until audited and then must be microfilmed for retention until their destruction pursuant toNRS 239.051.

section.heading: Insurer to provide office in State and statewide toll-free telephone service; private carrier to provide adequate services and information to control losses and prevent accidents and occupational diseases; requirement of availability for communication in real time.

content.p: Every insurer shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide an office in this State operated by the insurer or its third-party administrator in which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A complete file, or a reproduction of the complete file, of each claim is accessible, in accordance with the provisions ofNRS 616B.021; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Persons authorized to act for the insurer and, if necessary, licensed pursuant tochapter 683Aof NRS, may receive information related to a claim and provide the services to an employer and his or her employees required bychapters 616Ato617, inclusive, of NRS; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An employee or his or her employer, upon request, is provided with information related to a claim filed by the employee or a copy or other reproduction of the information from the file for that claim, in accordance with the provisions ofNRS 616B.021. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide statewide toll-free telephone service to the office maintained pursuant to paragraph
. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Each private carrier shall provide: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Adequate services to its insured employers in controlling losses; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Adequate information on the prevention of industrial accidents and occupational diseases. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An employee of a private carrier who is licensed as a company adjuster pursuant tochapter 684Aof NRS or a person who acts as a third-party administrator pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS for a private carrier who administers a claim arising underchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS from a location outside of this State pursuant to subsection 1 ofNRS 616B.0275shall make himself or herself available to communicate in real time with the claimant or a representative of the claimant Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. local time in this State, excluding any day declared to be a legal holiday pursuant toNRS 236.015.

section.heading: Location of administration of claims; authority of Commissioner to waive requirements and adopt regulations.

content.p: An employee of a private carrier who is licensed as a company adjuster pursuant tochapter 684Aof NRS or a person who acts as a third-party administrator pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS for a private carrier may administer claims arising underchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS from a location in or outside of this State. All records concerning a claim administered pursuant to this subsection must be maintained at one or more offices located in this State or by computer in a microphotographic, electronic or other similar format that produces an accurate reproduction of the original. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An employee of a private carrier who is not licensed as a company adjuster pursuant tochapter 684Aof NRS or a person who acts as a third-party administrator pursuant tochapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS for a self-insured employer or an association of self-insured public or private employers may administer claims arising underchapters 616Ato616D, inclusive, or chapter617of NRS only from one or more offices located in this State. All records concerning a claim administered pursuant to this subsection must be maintained in those offices. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Commissioner may: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Under exceptional circumstances, waive the requirements of subsections 1 and 2; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of this section.

section.heading: Modified program of industrial insurance for offenders in prison industry or work program.

content.p: Any offender confined at the state prison, while engaged in work in a prison industry or work program, whether the program is operated by an institution of the Department of Corrections, by contract with a public entity or by a private employer, is entitled to coverage under the modified program of industrial insurance established by regulations adopted by the Division if the Director of the Department of Corrections complies with the provisions of the regulations, and coverage is approved by a private carrier. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An offender is limited to the rights and remedies established by the provisions of the modified program of industrial insurance established by regulations adopted by the Division. The offender is not entitled to any rights and remedies established by the provisions ofchapters 616Ato617, inclusive, of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Division shall, in cooperation with the Department of Corrections and the Risk Management Division of the Department of Administration, adopt regulations setting forth a modified program of industrial insurance to provide offenders with industrial insurance against personal injuries arising out of and in the course of their work in a prison industry or work program.
